data.title: On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous
data.description: Book of the Month for April 2020: Ocean Vuong's *On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous: A Novel*. This novel is a letter from a son to his mother that explores the complicated truths of their love. Our first book discussion will be on Monday, April 13th at 7:00 pm, but we can talk all month long using Zoom. Send an email to [hello@allysonjeffredo.com ](mailto:hello@allysonjeffredo.com) with an introduction to be added to the group!

data.title: There There: A Novel
data.description: Book of the Month for May 2020: Tommy Orange's *There There: A Novel.* Based in Oakland, California, Orange's debut novel follows the lives of 12 interconnected characters as they travel to the Big Oakland Powwow, where all the stories converge in a fascinating and heartbreaking event. Our book discussion will take place on Monday, May 18th at 7:00 pm. Send an email to [hello@allysonjeffredo.com](mailto:hello@allysonjeffredo.com) with an introduction to be invited to attended!

data.title: The Body is Not an Apology: The Power of Radical Self-Love
data.description: Book of the Month for June 2020: Sonya Renee Taylor's powerful self-love text *The Body is Not an Apology: The Power of Radical Self-Love*. Taylor's text offers guidance on how one can begin the process of radical self-love when faced with a society that actively advocates for self-shame with intrusive narratives about body, sexuality, gender and others. This narratives frequently setup an unattainable ideal leaving many feeling "not normal" or "not good enough." Our book discussion will be on Monday, June 15th at 7:00 pm via Zoom. Send an email to [hello@allysonjeffredo.com](mailto:hello@allysonjeffredo.com) with an introduction to be added to the group!

data.title: How to Be an Antiracist
data.description: Book of the Month for July 2020: Ibram X. Kendi's bestseller, *How to be an Antiracist.* This text explores the importance of moving beyond the passive stance of being "not racist" to proactively become an "antiracist." Our book discussion will take place on Monday, July 20th at 7:00 pm via Zoom. Send an email to [hello@allysonjeffredo.com](mailto:hello@allysonjeffredo.com) with an introduction to be added to the group!
